sentences.en: Bob , who had no intention of working, leaned lazily on his spade.
sentences.cn: 鲍勃不想干活, 懒洋洋地倚在铁铲上.

sentences.en: Dad uses a spade to dig the garden.
sentences.cn: 爸爸用铁锹翻花园里的土.

sentences.en: He dug the ground with a spade.
He prefered, in his grandiloquent way , to call a spade a spade.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢夸夸其谈地谈出事实的真相来.

sentences.en: He sank the spade into the ground, and went at it.
sentences.cn: 他把铁锹插到地里，开始卖力地干了起来。

sentences.en: His spade cleaved the firm sand with a satisfying crunch.
sentences.cn: 他的锹凿开了坚实的砂土,发出令人舒心的嘎扎声.

sentences.en: I believe in calling a spade a spade.
I'm not at all secretive, and I'm pretty good at calling a spade a spade.
sentences.cn: 我不会遮遮掩掩，我喜欢直言不讳。

sentences.en: The best implement for digging a garden is a spade.
sentences.cn: 在花园里挖土的最好工具是铁锹.

sentences.en: The spade and fork have longer shafts, providing better leverage.
sentences.cn: 锹和耙的手柄较长，可发挥较好的杠杆作用。

sentences.en: The spade sank into a clump of overgrown bushes.
sentences.cn: 铲子插入了一丛长势旺盛的灌木丛。

sentences.en: They had financial trouble in spades.
sentences.cn: 他们在经济上遇到了极大困难

sentences.en: This spade is no good. I'll go and get another one.
sentences.cn: 这铁锹不中用, 我去换一把吧.
这把铁锹使起来挺顺手.

sentences.en: Turn the soil over with a spade.

trans.tran_cn: 铁锹，铲子，（纸牌中的）黑桃
trans.tran_en: a tool for digging that has a long handle and a broad metal blade that you push into the ground
